definitions: having a surface covered or decorated with paint that has been applied
having cosmetics applied to the face, especially heavily or noticeably
examples: The painted walls looked fresh and bright after renovation
We admired the beautifully painted furniture in the antique shop
Her painted lips were bright red for the performance
The actress appeared with heavily painted eyes and cheeks

definitions: joined or associated together as two of a kind forming a couple
arranged or matched with another thing to form a set or complement
examples: The paired dancers moved gracefully across the ballroom floor
Scientists observed the paired birds building their nest together
The paired socks were neatly arranged in the drawer
Each student was paired with a mentor for the program

definitions: having a pleasant or acceptable taste that makes food or drink enjoyable
acceptable or agreeable to someone's sensibilities, mind, or feelings
examples: The chef made the healthy vegetables more palatable with herbs
This wine is quite palatable despite its low price
The committee made the proposal more palatable to voters
His explanation was barely palatable to the skeptical audience

definitions: resembling a palace in being spacious, grand, and impressively luxurious
examples: The celebrity's palatial mansion overlooked the ocean
They stayed in a palatial hotel suite during their honeymoon

definitions: relating to the early phase of the Stone Age characterized by primitive stone tools
examples: Archaeologists discovered paleolithic cave paintings in southern France
The museum displayed paleolithic tools used by early humans

definitions: providing relief from symptoms without dealing with the underlying cause of a condition
examples: The doctor prescribed palliative care to ease her pain
Palliative treatments helped improve his quality of life

definitions: having an unhealthy pale appearance, typically because of poor health or shock
lacking in vitality, force, or conviction; uninspiring or insipid
examples: His pallid complexion suggested he hadn't been outside in weeks
The patient's pallid skin concerned the medical staff
The movie received pallid reviews from unimpressed critics
Her pallid attempt at humor fell flat with the audience

definitions: able to be touched or felt, especially by medical examination
so intense or obvious as to be almost felt or touched
examples: The doctor found a palpable lump during the examination
The swelling was palpable beneath the skin surface
There was palpable tension in the room during negotiations
The excitement in the stadium was palpable before kickoff

definitions: very small or meager in amount, especially inadequate or insignificant
petty, worthless, or trivial in nature or quality
examples: They offered a paltry sum for such valuable work
His paltry salary barely covered basic living expenses
She dismissed his paltry excuses for being late
The paltry decorations did nothing to improve the room

definitions: relating to or affecting the pancreas, a gland that produces digestive enzymes and hormones
examples: The patient was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer last month
Pancreatic enzymes help break down food during digestion

definitions: occurring over a wide geographic area and affecting an exceptionally high proportion of the population
examples: The pandemic disease spread rapidly across multiple continents
Pandemic flu outbreaks have occurred throughout human history

definitions: covered, lined, or decorated with flat rectangular sections of wood or other material
examples: The paneled walls gave the library a distinguished appearance
They restored the original paneled ceiling in the dining room

definitions: affected by sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety, often causing wildly unthinking behavior
examples: The panicked crowd rushed toward the emergency exits
She made panicked phone calls when her child went missing

definitions: showing a wide, unobstructed view of an extensive area in all directions
examples: The restaurant offered panoramic views of the city skyline
We took panoramic photographs from the mountain summit

definitions: relating to the pope or the papacy, especially regarding official duties or positions
examples: The papal decree was read in churches worldwide
Cardinals gathered for the papal election in Vatican City

definitions: having a flexible paper cover rather than a stiff board cover
examples: She preferred paperback books for traveling because they're lighter
The paperback edition costs much less than the hardcover

definitions: having the thin, dry, or rustling qualities characteristic of paper
examples: The flower petals had a delicate papery texture
His papery skin showed every vein underneath

definitions: having the shape of a parabola or relating to mathematical parabolas
expressed in or relating to a parable or using symbolic narrative
examples: The satellite dish had a parabolic shape for signal focus
Engineers calculated the parabolic trajectory of the projectile
Jesus often taught using parabolic stories about everyday life
The author's parabolic style conveyed deep truths indirectly

definitions: having the nature of a paradox; seemingly absurd or self-contradictory but possibly true
examples: It's paradoxical that technology connects yet isolates us
The paradoxical situation required creative problem solving

definitions: side by side and having the same distance continuously between them
occurring or existing at the same time or in a similar way; corresponding
examples: The parallel lines never intersect on the geometric plane
Cars parked in parallel rows filled the parking lot
The two stories show parallel themes of redemption
Scientists discovered parallel evolution in different species

definitions: causing paralysis or loss of the ability to move
affected by paralysis; unable to move part or all of the body
examples: The paralytic poison quickly immobilized the prey
Doctors identified the paralytic agent in his system
The paralytic patient required constant medical care
After the accident, his legs remained paralytic

definitions: partly or wholly incapable of movement due to injury or disease
rendered unable to think or act normally, especially through panic or fear
examples: The accident left him paralyzed from the waist down
Her paralyzed arm slowly regained some movement
She stood paralyzed with fear during the earthquake
The company seemed paralyzed by indecision

definitions: organized similarly to a military force but not part of official armed services
examples: The paramilitary group conducted training exercises
Paramilitary police units responded to the emergency

definitions: more important than anything else; supreme in rank, importance, or authority
examples: Patient safety is paramount in medical practice
The paramount concern was protecting civilian lives

definitions: unreasonably or obsessively anxious, suspicious, or mistrustful
characterized by delusions of persecution or exaggerated self-importance
examples: He became paranoid that his colleagues were plotting against him
Her paranoid behavior alienated friends and family
The patient exhibited paranoid delusions requiring immediate treatment
His paranoid thoughts interfered with daily functioning

definitions: denoting events or phenomena that are beyond the scope of normal scientific understanding
examples: The investigators studied paranormal activity in the house
Many people report paranormal experiences they cannot explain

definitions: relating to Grenada, its people, culture, or language
examples: The Grenadian government announced new tourism initiatives
We enjoyed traditional Grenadian cuisine during our visit

definitions: relating to Guatemala, its people, culture, or language
examples: The museum featured ancient Guatemalan artifacts and textiles
Guatemalan coffee is renowned for its exceptional quality

definitions: relating to Guinea, its people, culture, or language in West Africa
examples: The Guinean delegation attended the international conference
Traditional Guinean music filled the cultural center

definitions: relating to Guyana, its people, culture, or language in South America
examples: The Guyanese community celebrated their independence day
We sampled delicious Guyanese curry at the festival

definitions: relating to Haiti, its people, culture, or Creole language
examples: Haitian art reflects vibrant cultural traditions and history
The Haitian relief effort received international support

definitions: relating to Hawaii, its people, culture, or Polynesian language
examples: The Hawaiian islands offer diverse landscapes and climates
We learned traditional Hawaiian dance at the luau

definitions: relating to the Semitic language of the Jewish people
relating to the Jewish people or their culture and traditions
examples: She studied Hebrew texts at the university
The ancient Hebrew manuscripts were carefully preserved
Hebrew traditions have been maintained for thousands of years
The Hebrew calendar follows lunar and solar cycles

definitions: relating to the German philosopher Hegel or his dialectical method of thesis, antithesis, synthesis
examples: The professor explained Hegelian dialectics to philosophy students
Her analysis followed a distinctly Hegelian approach

definitions: affected by paralysis of the legs and lower body, typically caused by spinal injury
examples: The paraplegic athlete competed in wheelchair basketball
After becoming paraplegic, she advocated for accessibility improvements

definitions: living as a parasite on or in another organism
habitually exploiting the hospitality or generosity of others without giving anything in return
examples: The parasitic worms affected the dog's digestive system
Scientists studied parasitic relationships in tropical ecosystems
His parasitic lifestyle depended entirely on wealthy friends
The company's parasitic practices drained local resources

definitions: dried out with heat; extremely dry, especially from heat or excessive thirst
examples: The parched earth cracked under the scorching sun
Her parched throat desperately needed water

definitions: left in a stationary position, especially referring to vehicles
examples: The parked cars lined both sides of the street
We found her bicycle parked outside the library

definitions: relating to, enacted by, or suitable to a parliament or legislative body
examples: The parliamentary debate lasted well into the night
She followed proper parliamentary procedure during the meeting

definitions: having a limited or narrow outlook or scope, especially provincial
relating to a church parish or ecclesiastical district
examples: His parochial attitudes prevented him from appreciating diversity
The committee's parochial interests ignored broader community needs
The parochial school served families in the local parish
They attended the parochial church every Sunday

definitions: moved apart or separated; divided into parts or sections
examples: Her parted lips revealed a gentle smile
The curtains were parted to let in morning light

definitions: taking part or becoming involved in an activity or event
examples: All participating students received certificates of completion
The participating nations agreed to the climate accord

definitions: allowing or encouraging people to take part in something or share in decisions
examples: The participatory workshop encouraged everyone to contribute ideas
They implemented participatory democracy in local governance

definitions: consisting of or relating to separate particles, especially minute particles of matter
examples: The air filter removes particulate matter from indoor air
Scientists measured particulate pollution levels in the city

definitions: strongly supporting a particular party, cause, or person, often without considering alternatives
prejudiced in favor of a particular cause; biased
examples: The partisan crowd cheered only for their team
Partisan politics prevented meaningful legislative progress
The newspaper's partisan reporting lacked objectivity
His partisan views made fair judgment impossible

definitions: alternative spelling of partisan; strongly supporting a particular party or cause
examples: The partizan fighters defended their territory fiercely
His partizan loyalty never wavered despite criticism

definitions: good enough but not excellent; just acceptable
able to be crossed or traveled through
examples: The meal was passable but nothing special
His passable performance earned a passing grade
The mountain road is barely passable in winter
The river was passable only at low tide

definitions: no longer fashionable, current, or relevant; out of date
examples: Her passe hairstyle belonged to another decade
Those management techniques are considered passe today

definitions: accepting or allowing what happens without active response or resistance
not active or not participating; receiving action without acting in return
examples: His passive acceptance of criticism surprised everyone
The passive audience barely reacted to the performance
The house uses passive solar heating to save energy
She played a passive role in the negotiations

definitions: stuck or fixed in position using paste or adhesive substance
examples: The pasted wallpaper began peeling at the corners
Children's artwork was pasted on the classroom walls
